title: SmileTelecom (Uganda)
text: Smile Communications Uganda (SCU) was established in November 2009 and launched its <a href="LTE%20%28telecommunication%29">4G LTE</a> operations in June 2013 in <a href="Kampala">Kampala</a>, the capital and largest city of <a href="Uganda">Uganda</a>. SCU is a subsidiary of Smile Telecoms Holdings, a <a href="Mauritius">Mauritius</a>-based pan-African telecommunications group with operations in <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a>, Uganda, <a href="Smile%20Communications%20Tanzania">Tanzania</a>, the <a href="Democratic%20Republic%20of%20the%20Congo">Democratic Republic of the Congo</a>, and <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>. SCU has since expanded its 4G LTE services, including the cities and towns of <a href="Fort%20Portal">Fort Portal</a>, <a href="Gulu">Gulu</a>, <a href="Jinja%2C%20Uganda">Jinja</a>, <a href="Kabale">Kabale</a>, <a href="Masaka">Masaka</a>, <a href="Masindi">Masindi</a>, <a href="Mbale">Mbale</a>, <a href="Mbarara">Mbarara</a>, <a href="Mukono%20Town">Mukono</a>, <a href="Soroti">Soroti</a>, <a href="Tororo">Tororo</a>, and <a href="Wakiso%20Town">Wakiso</a>. SCU's voice-over-LTE, called "<a href="VoLTE">VoLTE</a>", is compatible with the <a href="iPhone">iPhone</a> and <a href="Android%20%28operating%20system%29">Android</a> systems. It enables Smile customers to call around the world, fixed or mobile, using the SmileVoice App.
